data: Establishes a lexical resource based on WordNet, assigning sentiment scores (objective, positive, negative) to its individual word meanings (synsets).

Contains approximately 5,000 text snippets collected from financial news and media releases concerning Finnish companies traded on the NASDAQ OMX Nordic Exchange. Each snippet is labeled as positive, negative, or neutral.

A dataset for understanding sentiment in financial texts, which integrates artificial intelligence and semantic web technologies to better identify, interpret, and process concepts within this context.

Involves entity-sentiment annotation to face the challenge of headlines containing multiple entities with conflicting sentiments. This human-annotated dataset, with over 10,700 news headlines, provides insight into sentiment analyses based on specific entities in financial news.

A dataset of tokenized and annotated Federal Open Market Committee (FOMC) speeches, meeting minutes, and press conference transcripts. This resource aims to understand the impact of monetary policy on financial markets by analyzing the language used by the central bank.

A dataset annotating relationships in financial documents, extracted from SEC 10-X filings, with approximately 29,000 instances and 22 relationship types across eight entity pairs (e.g., person-title, org-money). Useful for identifying relationships between entities in financial reports.
Compiled from various news sources and evaluated by human experts, allowing researchers to explore how news headlines influence price movements, asset comparison, and other financial events.
A dataset created for Named Entity Recognition (NER) within the financial domain, useful for identifying and classifying financial companies within text data.

Provides a multilingual financial NLP dataset with real-world financial article headlines from 15 languages. Annotated with high-level and low-level topics, facilitating multi-class and multi-label classification tasks.
A collection of question-answer pairs with deep analysis regarding financial reports. It focuses on deep reasoning over financial data, providing clean data for answering complex financial queries.
